There is not currently a way to access the polynomial coefficients in  
MATLAB.  Of course, they are right there in the CTI input file, so it  
would not be too hard to write a script to parse that and convert it  
into MATLAB matrices that could be read into MATLAB from a file.

The capability to access the coefficients was recently added in C++,  
but it has not yet made its way up to MATLAB or Python.

Is it not accurate enough to simply do a finite-difference  
approximation to dcp/dT, using a very small temperature difference?  
That is easy to do, unless there is some reason to do something more  
complex.

Dave


On Nov 24, 2006, at 9:15 AM, Michele Vascellari wrote:

> Hello,
>
> Does it exist in Matlab Cantera toolbox a method to evaluate the  
> partial
> derivative of specific heat with respect to the temperature (dcp/ 
> dT), or
> at least a method to show the NASA polynomial coefficients of the
> mixture?
>
> Best regards
>
> Michele
